events.name: FOSSASIA
events.description: The Smart City with Open Source, Big Data, Design Thinking and Free Knowledge Tools at Asia's Premier Open Technology Event

events.name: FOSSASIA
events.description:
FOSSASIA 2015 is an exciting Open Technology event for developers, students, and start ups using open source to build up their businesses. It is a unique opportunity to share the latest innovations in open source technologies and meet contributors and potential partners. FOSSASIA 2015 will take place for the first time in Singapore. It will be held at Plug-In@Blk71 from March 13-15.  Since the first FOSSASIA meetup in 2009 in Ho Chi Minh City, FOSSASIA has taken the lead to organize Free and Open Source Software conferences in Asia. Past FOSSASIA events have attracted over 1400 participants, speakers from 24 countries, and  more than 100 volunteers. More than half of all participants were women. 
Locations: 
1) Friday March 13, 9AM-5PM: The Opening event will take place on Friday March 13 at Biopolis, Matrix Auditorium, Level 2, 30 Biopolis Street (MRT Buona Vista).  
2) Saturday March 14/Sunday March 15, 9AM-5PM: 6 Tracks will take place at Launchpad Campus in Blk71 and Blk79 in 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, 139951 Singapore (MRT One North).
events.location: Biopolis, , Matrix Auditorium, Level 2, 30 Biopolis Street, Singapore null

events.name: FOSSASIA Open Technology Event - Opening at Biopolis
events.description: Join us at FOSSASIA 2015 Opening Event at Biopolis in Singapore this Friday. FIVE DAYS TO GO! Get your free tickets and invite your friends to do so now! FOSSASIA is an open technology conference, focused on the Asian continent, that offers developers, start-ups, hardware tinkerers and students an opportunity to meet, share ideas, and collaborate. Every year, tech communities from around Asia get together with fellow technology enthusiasts from around the world for days of learning and sharing. We have over 120 speakers. 90+ International speakers are flying in from around the world. Official Conference Registration: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com Program Friday March 13 9:00 AM Registration 9:30 AM Welcome by Hong Phuc Dang, Mario Behling, Harish Pillay 9:40 AM Bunnie Huang, Bunnie Studios, Novena 10:00 PM Mar Canet, Soft Digital Fabrication 10:20 AM Stefan Koehler, CronusConsult, The Power Of Free: How LiMux serves 15.000 10:40 AM Shout-Outs "Amazing OpenTech from Singapore and around the World" 10:50 AM Snack 11:05 AM Colin Charles, MariaDB , MariaDB - State of the Base 11:30 AM Gen Kanai, Mozilla, Paticipation in Mozilla and We achieve the Next Generation Open Web 11:55 AM Michael Christen, LokLak, Distributed Search and Open Index with Loklak 12:15 PM Lunch 1:15 PM Georg Greve, Kolab Systems AG, Collaborate with ease and confidence 1:40 PM Brian Proffitt, Red Hat Cutting Through The Container Hype 2:05 PM Feature Talks Roland Turner, Yahi: Crowd-Sourced Haze-Mapping, Internet of Things and Real-Time Open Data Jan Jongboom, Telenor Digital, Abusing mobile phones to make Internet of Things Mohit Kanwal, Pie Insecure Android Apps in Google Play Julien Lavergne, Lubuntu, Create your own distribution Remi Denis-Courmont, VideoLAN, VLC media player: news and future Italo Vignoli, The Document Foundation MIgrating to LibreOffice to reduce the desktop Total Cost of Ownership: methodology and case studies Emily Chen, GNOME, Open Data Platform based on CKAN Thomas Gorrisson, Temasys, Skylink.JS 3:05 PM Tea and Coffee 3:15 PM Lennart Poettering, Red Hat, systemd: where we come from, and where we want to go in 2015 3:35 PM Ryusuke Kajiyama, Oracle Corporation Japan, The State of the Dolphin 3:55 PM Kushal Das, Python Software Foundation Exciting days with Python 4:15 PM Bernd Erk, Icinga, Open Source Monitoring with Icinga 4:30 PM Rasmus Skjoldan, TYPO3 Designing a new content management system poses a beautiful problem: How do you design a tool you don’t know the exact future use of? 4:50 PM End of Sessions 6:00 PM Labrador Park Participants Get Together +++ FOSSASIA continues on Sat/Sun March 14/15 at Launchpad Blk71 and Blk79 +++ Links Website http://fossasia.org Twitter: http://twitter.com/fossasia

events.name: TGIFHacks #31 - ACM ICPC
events.description: The ACM International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC) is the premiere global programming competition for college undergraduates. It is sponsored annually by IBM and Baylor University, and is now in its 39th year. ICPC challenges the problem solving abilities and programming skills of contestants on a wide range of interesting computer science problems. NTU organizes a number of ICPC teams each year. To help train students, we also hold weekly practice contests and discussions conducted by SCE faculty and PhD students. In October to December each year, we organize trips to regional contests. Top finishers then go on to compete in the world finals in May. NTU has been highly successful at ICPC, advancing to the world finals 10 out the last 12 years. This year our AAA team will compete in the finals in Morocco. Join us this Friday to learn more about ACM ICPC at NTU. See the problems and techniques used to solve those problems, meet participants and trainers, elaborate on complicated problems and finally, those who wish can try to compete in a short ICPC-like contest. The speakers this week are A/P Rui Fan, Senior Research Scientist Kevin Jones, and PhD student Lubos Krcal. Dr. Fan joined NTU in 2010 after getting his PhD from MIT. He is interested in algorithms and theoretical solutions to practical problems. Outline of the talk: About ACM ICPC Experience from previous competitions and finales Some advanced techniques students learn / use in ICPC Sample problem analysis (about 3 problems) ICPC-like competition for all attendees

events.name: FOSSASIA Social Event at Labrador Seaside View BBQ
events.description: Let’s get together with speakers and attendees of FOSSASIA 2015 at Labrador Seaside View BBQ! We will have four superb cuisine chefs who are known for their delicious BBQ food creations. Different meat, vegetarian and vegan options are available. Typical Singaporean beverages are served during the party. Of course there will be music and like in previous years we hope to see some international dance performances of our participants from around the world! The beautiful Labrador park is our perfect location to enjoy the friendly company of FOSSASIA participants at the seaside. Get a ticket here ! Date: Friday, March 13 Time: 6.45PM Location: Labrador Park Seaside View BBQ Directions: Public Transport: Labrador Park Station - Circle Line Station | Drive: 12~15 min drive, or 5 stops/10 min MRT (+ 10 min walk) Please get a ticket for the social event at: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com About Labrador Park The park is a hidden gem and an unusual historical relic in otherwise ultra-modern Singapore located right at the seaside. First developed in the mid-19th century as Fort Pasir Panjang, the fortifications in today’s Labrador Park were later renamed the Labrador Battery in the 1930s as the British Army prepared for a possible Japanese invasion. More Info on TA and Wikipedia . Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia Tickets: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com Labrador Park Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labrador_Nature_Reserve
events.location: Labrador Park MRT (CC27) Station Control, Labrador Park, Singapore
